experience.location: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States

experience.description:
•	Coordinated the timely collection and testing of environmental samples
•	Oversaw lab activities to ensure compliance within regulatory guidelines
•	Further established the training and continuous development of lab analysts
•	Managed and assisted with various site-wide projects and investigations, including identification/mapping of compressed gas systems and aseptic Continuous Particle Monitoring System (CPMS)
•	Analyzed and authorized daily/weekly/monthly reports within LIMS

•	Collaborated with project managers to evaluate installation of new aseptic filling suites and determined sample frequency/locations to meet regulatory requirements
•	Facilitated interdepartmental strategy meetings across all levels
•	Scheduled and provided oversight for Media Fill Inspections
•	Managed all Environmental Monitoring Lab equipment, implemented new equipment, coordinated with external vendor services to ensure timely calibration/repairs, and submitted PO requests for services

•	Subject Matter Expert in Environmental Viable and Non-Viable (Particulate) Monitoring, Data Integrity, 21 CFR Parts 11, 210, and 211, Project Management, and Commercial Manufacturing Support
•	Technical Knowledge in Aseptic Clean Room Processes, Laboratory Testing Techniques, Equipment Validation, Cleaning Validation, Combination Product Design, RCA Investigations, and cGMP Technical Writing
•	Conducts external audits of testing providers to ensure compliance against 21 CFR / ISO guidelines and internal procedures.
•	Evaluates client manufacturing processes/procedures and recommends changes for continuous improvement

whatIDoHere: As the Manager of Analytical Operations, I primarily work on projects related to GMP QC laboratories. Whether is performing investigations, developing SOPs or conducting audits, I always strive to leave a positive impact on our clients!
title: Manager, Biologics QC
bio: Experienced commercial Quality Control Scientist with 10 years of experience in aseptic pharmaceutical manufacturing and microbiology laboratory management. Strong background in environmental monitoring program implementation, analytical procedure development, and project management, with knowledge of cGMP/GDP/GLP regulations. I hold a Bachelor of Science in Microbiology from the University of Florida.

experience.description:
- Oversee the Kymanox MS&T + Process Engineering team by providing technical and project support to the team and plan for utilization on projects. 
- Work with the Business Development team to identify project opportunities, meet with potential clients, and review proposals. 
- Engineering, Validation, CMMS (Blue Mountain), and Operational Readiness support for a client in the radiopharmaceutical space.
- Technical Project Manager for the launch of a new BSL-2 Cell & Gene Therapy R&D laboratory. 
- Technical project manager for the buildout of a new 503B compounding facility. 
- Medical device complaints program by developing investigation templates and author investigations for one of the devices.

- Lead the Process Engineering, Technical Services, Plant Engineering/ Maintenance/Calibration, and Validation groups (7 managers, 40 employees overall, 4 locations) 
- Developed strategies to continue capital projects and maintain support for manufacturing processes while also shifting resources to more critical business objectives (remediation).  
- Critical projects included: new clean room, Rockwell plant- wide Ethernet networks, site Validation Master Plans, overhaul of the Calibration program, specification & build of IBM Maximo Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS), restart plans for Memphis, TN facility, launch of the visual inspection program, and many more. 
- Significant involvement in remediation activities required by PharMEDium’s Consent Decree received May 2019.

- Established a collaborative environment through launch of Smartsheet.
- Regulatory responses and remediation activities.  Developed strategies and process improvements to address FDA 483, State Boards of Pharmacy, and internal audit observations (related to Engineering). 
- Engineering strategy development and capital planning to meet corporate production ramp up schedules. 
- Implementation of automated syringe filling and labeling lines. 
- Design and implementation of automated bag filling and labeling lines. 
- Implementation of Rockwell Converged Plant Wide Ethernet networks (CPwE) in four manufacturing centers with dedicated data centers in three of the facilities.
- Oversight of design for ampule & vial pooling automation, and custom peristaltic pumps.

- Manage the engineering function with a focus on process development projects including:  custom automation equipment procurement, production scale-up, cost reduction, and capacity expansion. 
- Use well developed knowledge of process automation to assess and supply strategic direction for short, medium, and long term automation strategy.  
- Manage execution of projects for automating manufacturing operations to reduce costs, increase output, and improve quality of current and future products. Identify new technology and continuous improvements to products, processes and equipment.  Provide input and oversight on CAPEX and department budgets; manage and monitor project and functional budgets.

Sterilization Program lead
- Validated and launched new autoclave. 
- Identified and implemented improvements to all three Getinge autoclaves. 
- Production and Quality support for troubleshooting, NCRs, and CAPAs.
- Annual qualifications of autoclaves and new product qualifications. 

Lead project engineer for new injection molding supplier (Phillips-Medisize) 
- Qualification of syringe molding process, automated pad printing, and semi-automated assembly. 
- Provide project management, engineering & validation support, and inventory planning for transition to new supplier. 

Water systems 
- Project lead for Reverse Osmosis/Deionized Water system to complete remediation of the system, re-write of the Performance Qualification protocol, and execute the yearlong qualification.

- Led critical problem solving teams to avoid missed product deliveries and lengthy production down time for sterile and non-sterile filling/capping/packaging lines and robotic packing lines 
- Supported daily operations and trouble shooting of liquid filling lines 
- Coordinated Validation, Operations, and Engineering teams on compliance, production efficiency, and plant decommissioning projects 
- Supervised 14 mechanics across 3 shifts in an aseptic liquid filling and packaging facility 
- Operations representative for the Validation Review Board

- Led all validation activities for the commissioning and qualification of a new, state-of-the-art blister-packing machine 
- Shared management responsibilities for the Validation department during a 2-month time without a department manager 
- Coordinated Validation Review Board meetings, which approved over 2000 documents annually 
- Assist with audit preparations, interactions, and responses 
- Co-author of the Validation Master Plan (VMP) 
- Assist with updates to the division cleaning validation policies 
- Write, execute, and compile cleaning validation protocols

title: Director, MS&T
bio:
Demonstrated leader with strong technical problem solving and project management skills in the pharmaceutical, 503B compounding, & medical device industries. 
Experience growing, developing, and leading teams across multiple facilities by setting strategies, priorities, and expectations. Over 20 years of broad experience in Quality and Engineering disciplines including project management, facility design, facility start-up, plant engineering, automation design & validation, computer system validation, regulatory responses, consent decree remediation, cleaning validation, sterilization, water systems, injection molding, form/fill/seal, blow/fill/seal, aseptic processing, compounding, maintenance, and continuous improvement.

whatIDoHere: I manage manufacturing quality projects at Kymanox, as well as support quality systems (eQMS), internal Kymanox quality processes, and compliance initiatives.
title: Manager, Manufacturing Quality
bio:
Brittany Bell (Alston) has been working at Kymanox since February 2019.

She has experience in biopharma, medical device, API pharmaceutical, and sterile compounding operations and compliance. 
Brittany has expertise in purification process development, scale up, technology transfer, process validation, investigations, root cause analysis and remediation, CGMP quality and compliance support, auditing and gap assessments, manufacturing quality and batch disposition. 

Brittany is an ASQ Certified Quality Auditor. She graduated from North Carolina State University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biological & Agricultural Engineering and pursued graduate level coursework at the Biomanufacturing Training and Education Center, including Upstream, Downstream, and Lyophilization principles.

title: Director, Commissioning, Qualification and Validation

languages.description: I can order a beer, know the difference between a Berg and a Burg, and otherwise communicate as well as any 6-year-old German kid despite studying it for 8 years as an adult.
Taught myself during the pandemic with the help of Il Gufo di DuoLingo. Other than wine pronunciations, don't rely on me for much else...

bio:
As the Kymanox Director of Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation (CQV), I bring over two decades of experience in the pharma industry; from labs to production to quality I have lived it all.

Outside the world of CQV, I’m a rabid San Francisco 49er's (NFL) and Carolina Hurricanes (NHL) fan.

If you catch me at the office and want to play ping pong, I am always ready...

I also enjoy great wine and food; keep an eye out for wine tastings at HQ and group dinner invites!

title: Senior Director, Facilities + Automation
bio:
Working for an amazing company with a passion that matches my own! 

Kymanox is a life science professional services organization that offers engineering, scientific, compliance, and project management support to companies exclusively in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, medical device, and combination product industries. Kymanox helps clients navigate commercialization challenges that arise throughout a product’s life cycle – from early development to post-market support.
